p.s: Is there that person you want to know better ?
Do you feel like they are n't going to tell you anything ?
Do you want to be this person 's friend ?
If you answered yes to any of these questions then keep reading .

item.s: This is probably the most important step of all .
It 's simple too .
INTRODUCE YOURSELF !
You ca n't get close to a person or know more about them if they have no idea who you are .

figure.rend: Communicate with a Private Person Step 1.jpg

item.s: Try and get that person talking .
Find something they 're interested in and talk about that .
Helping this person feel comfortable around you will help them open up and communicate a little more .

figure.rend: Communicate with a Private Person Step 2.jpg

item.s: Hang out with this person .
Spending quality time with he or she will help this person feel like you want to be their friend , which will help them open up even more .

figure.rend: Communicate with a Private Person Step 3.jpg

item.s: Continue to try Step 2 and Step 3 until this person feels comfortable around you .
Once they 're comfortable around you and consider you a friend then you 've opened them up ! Congratulations !

figure.rend: Communicate with a Private Person Step 4.jpg

If you want to be more than friends with this person , then try
How to Get a Guy to Fall for You
or
How To Get A Girl To Like You

figure.rend: Communicate with a Private Person Step 5.jpg

item.s: Try and be friendly .
You ca n't be mean to this person and expect them to like you .
Treat this new friend of yours like any other friend .
Do n't try and get to know them to spill their secrets and humiliate them .
It 's not very fun to be humiliated in front of everyone that you know .
Do n't expect immediate results
Do n't give up and be persistent .
If that person says " I do n't want you around me " then just leave them alone .
But until they do , try and get to know them better .
Break them out of the shell they have .
If the person does n't warm up to you right away , do n't sweat it .
This is a private person so they may be trying to figure out if you 're friend or foe .
Make sure you are not exceeding the person 's comfort level .
Be mindful of their posture and expressions , to see if they are becoming nervous .

In the event that the person has social limitations or trust issues , it is important that they feel like you are a " safe " person to talk to , who would respect their boundaries and not try to pressure them into more conversation than they are comfortable with .
Some people have psychological disorders which make social interactions difficult for them .
It 's rare that they will simply announce this to you .
Be aware of this possibility , ahead of time .
While the person may simply be shy , they could also just as well be suffering from PTSD or Social Anxiety .
These conditions do not necessarily mean that they will never allow you to become close to them .
However , it may be at a different pace than the one you would normally expect .
Be respectful and do not impose your pace upon them .
A gentle and slow approach will give a them a greater sense of ease , and they will be more likely to open up to you .
